translated: Homage to glorious Nairātmya.

translated: will explain the instruction of Nairātmya.

original: 'dir bzlas pa dang bsgom pa'i dbang du byas pa snying rje'i ros byugs pa'i sems kyi rgyan can /
analyzed: 'dir bzlas pa dang bsgom pa'i dbang du byas pa snying rje'i ros byugs pa'i sems kyi rgyan can /
translated: Here, the one who is anointed with the taste of compassion, the ornament of the mind, is in the power of repetition and meditation.

original: byang chub kyi sems rin po che legs par gzung ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rin po che legs par gzung ba /
translated: Having well taken up the precious thought of enlightenment,

original: bla ma dang bdag med ma gnyis mi phyed par bsnyen bkur bas /
analyzed: bla ma dang bdag med ma gnyis mi phyed par bsnyen bkur bas /
translated: and having served the guru and Nairātmya inseparably,

original: dben zhing 'tshe ba med pa'i bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la /
analyzed: dben zhing 'tshe ba med pa'i bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la /
translated: one should enter the solitary, safe house of meditation.

original: aom raksha raksha h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom raksha raksha h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: 'dis ni khro bo'i ngag bar chad sel ba'i sngags brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni khro bo'i ngag bar chad sel ba'i sngags brjod pa ste /
translated: This is the recitation of the mantra of the wrathful one that removes obstacles.

original: gnas la sogs pa srung bar byed pa'o //🔽de nas khyad par du gyur pa'i stan la 'dug cing ci 'byor pa'i bdud rtsi @229a * //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa srung bar byed pa'o // de nas khyad par du gyur pa'i stan la 'dug cing ci 'byor pa'i bdud rtsi @229a * //
translated: It protects the place and so forth.

original: lnga la sogs pas byugs la /
analyzed: lnga la sogs pas byugs la /
translated: Then, sitting on a special seat, one should anoint it with whatever is available, such as the five nectars,🔽and scatter flowers there.

original: der me tog dgram par bya zhing ras ris la sogs par gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa lngas mchod cing stobs chen po las byas pa'i spos kyis rab tu bdugs shing rnam par dag pa'i sngags bzlas te bdag nyid bdag med mar mos par bya'o
analyzed: der me tog dgram par bya zhing ras ris la sogs par gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa lngas mchod cing stobs chen po las byas pa'i spos kyis rab tu bdugs shing rnam par dag pa'i sngags bzlas te bdag nyid bdag med mar mos par bya'o
translated: One should make offerings to the Bhagavatī who resides in the painting and so forth with the five offerings, and having fumigated with incense made from great strength, one should recite the purifying mantra and imagine oneself as Nairātmya.

original: // de'i rjes la sprul pa shing rta'i yan lag 'khor lo'i 'dab ma'i gdan can 'dab ma bzhi pa'i ze'u 'brur song ba /
analyzed: // de'i rjes la sprul pa shing rta'i yan lag 'khor lo'i 'dab ma'i gdan can 'dab ma bzhi pa'i ze'u 'brur song ba /
translated: After that, the emanation is on the seat of the petals of the wheel of the chariot, which is on the stamen of the four-petaled lotus.

original: srog song ba'i snying gar bsil ba'i 'od zer can gyi dkyil 'khor la su gandhe las skyes pa /
analyzed: srog song ba'i snying gar bsil ba'i 'od zer can gyi dkyil 'khor la su gandhe las skyes pa /
translated: At the heart of the life-force, the essence of the essence of the syllable su, arisen from suṃ, is the maṇḍala of the cool moon.

original: padma r'a ga'i 'od zer blangs la 'bar ba'i me lta bur 'od 'bar ba'i mgo skyes can dri ma med pa'i thod pa'i phreng ba byas pa'i thod can cung zad khro zhing dmar ba g-yo zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: padma r'a ga'i 'od zer blangs la 'bar ba'i me lta bur 'od 'bar ba'i mgo skyes can dri ma med pa'i thod pa'i phreng ba byas pa'i thod can cung zad khro zhing dmar ba g-yo zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa /
translated: Take the light rays of padmarāga, blazing like a blazing fire, with a crest of hair, wearing a garland of stainless skulls, slightly wrathful, red, with three eyes that are moving and round.

original: mi mgo khrag dang bcas pa'i phreng ba brgya'i phyed kyis lus la rgyan byas pa /
analyzed: mi mgo khrag dang bcas pa'i phreng ba brgya'i phyed kyis lus la rgyan byas pa /
translated: The body is adorned with a garland of a hundred human heads with blood.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i phyag rgya lngas lus la brgyan pa /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i phyag rgya lngas lus la brgyan pa /
translated: The body is adorned with the five beautiful mudras.

original: khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa dang rgyal mtshan g-yon gyis 'dzin cing /
analyzed: khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa dang rgyal mtshan g-yon gyis 'dzin cing /
translated: The left holds a skull cup filled with blood and a banner.

original: g-yas kyis gri gug 'dzin pa'i phyag ni pa la sha'i lo ma rgyas shing 'o ma 'dzin pa'i khur gyis mnan pa lta bu /
analyzed: g-yas kyis gri gug 'dzin pa'i phyag ni pa la sha'i lo ma rgyas shing 'o ma 'dzin pa'i khur gyis mnan pa lta bu /
translated: The right hand holding a flaying knife is like a leaf of the palasha tree, pressed down by the burden of milk.

original: dbus su gnyer ma gsum pa gcer bu rgyas shing skabs phyed pa'i 'phongs kyi cha can gar dgu'i ro dang ldan pa skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis mnan pa 'gying zhing rol par ldan pa legs pa'i na tshod can /
analyzed: dbus su gnyer ma gsum pa gcer bu rgyas shing skabs phyed pa'i 'phongs kyi cha can gar dgu'i ro dang ldan pa skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis mnan pa 'gying zhing rol par ldan pa legs pa'i na tshod can /
translated: In the middle is a three-wrinkle [navel], naked, full, and with a protruding buttocks, endowed with the expression of the nine moods, pressed down by the half-crossed dance, swaying and playful, with a beautiful age.

original: yid dga' ba'i gnas nas 'od zer gyi tshogs 'char ba chos kyi sgo las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs can du bdag med ma blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid dga' ba'i gnas nas 'od zer gyi tshogs 'char ba chos kyi sgo las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs can du bdag med ma blta bar bya'o //
translated: From the place of the joy of the mind, the rising mass of light rays, arisen from the door of Dharma, with the form of correct exalted wisdom, one should view Nairātmya.

original: de nas chos ji lta bas dam tshig la ye shes gzhug pa byas la de'i mig dang sku la sogs pa rnam par dag par mos so //
analyzed: de nas chos ji lta bas dam tshig la ye shes gzhug pa byas la de'i mig dang sku la sogs pa rnam par dag par mos so //
translated: Then, having caused the introduction to the exalted wisdom of the pledge just as it is, one should imagine that her eyes, body, and so forth are completely purified.

original: de'i rtsibs dang ldan pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo bde ba'i snying po'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i rtsibs dang ldan pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo bde ba'i snying po'i gzhi ste /
translated: The basis of the essence of bliss, which has the nature of Vajradhara, is endowed with spokes.

original: sindhu ra'i tshogs sam snga dro'i mtshams ltar dmar ba dang po mchog gi snying por bde ba chen po'i rtsibs dang ldan pa nas 'bab pa /
analyzed: sindhu ra'i tshogs sam snga dro'i mtshams ltar dmar ba dang po mchog gi snying por bde ba chen po'i rtsibs dang ldan pa nas 'bab pa /
translated: The first red [drop] is like the assembly of Sindūra or the morning, and it falls from the supreme essence endowed with the spoke of great bliss.

original: dbus kyi rtsa nas zhu ba 'bab pa'i rgyun gyi dbyibs can skyes pa /
analyzed: dbus kyi rtsa nas zhu ba 'bab pa'i rgyun gyi dbyibs can skyes pa /
translated: The shape of the stream of the descending flow is generated from the central nāḍī.

original: rdo rje'i mchod rten yan lag la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye mched kyi ngo bo rnams g-yas dang g-yon dang 'og gzhi'i phyogs su song ba rnams /
analyzed: rdo rje'i mchod rten yan lag la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye mched kyi ngo bo rnams g-yas dang g-yon dang 'og gzhi'i phyogs su song ba rnams /
translated: The shape of the vajra stūpa is the nature of the dependent origination of the sense bases, which are on the right, left, and lower sides.

original: skar khung dra ba'i rnam pa can gyi gnas bcu gnyis su skad cig ma dang dga' ba dang dbang du ston pa zlum zhing @229b dang ba'i mu tig dmar po'i rdog ma'i rnam pa lta bu thig le bcu gnyis rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: skar khung dra ba'i rnam pa can gyi gnas bcu gnyis su skad cig ma dang dga' ba dang dbang du ston pa zlum zhing @229b dang ba'i mu tig dmar po'i rdog ma'i rnam pa lta bu thig le bcu gnyis rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: The twelve moments, joys, and powers are the twelve bindus that are round and clear, like the shape of a red pearl, in the twelve locations of the lattice windows.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'i ngo bo rnams kyi gnas bzhi dang / rdo rje bzhi'i bdag nyid dang yi ge bzhi'i rnam pa dang sku bzhir bsgom par bya'o //🔽de la steng gi gnas ni rdo rje rin po che'i rnam pa sku rdo rjer bskyed pa'i skye ba can ston ka'i ri bong can lta bu'o //🔽g-yon pa'i gnas ni zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa gsung rdo rje'i myu gu skyed par byed pa rin po che padma r'a ga lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'i ngo bo rnams kyi gnas bzhi dang / rdo rje bzhi'i bdag nyid dang yi ge bzhi'i rnam pa dang sku bzhir bsgom par bya'o // de la steng gi gnas ni rdo rje rin po che'i rnam pa sku rdo rjer bskyed pa'i skye ba can ston ka'i ri bong can lta bu'o // g-yon pa'i gnas ni zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa gsung rdo rje'i myu gu skyed par byed pa rin po che padma r'a ga lta bu'o //
translated: One should meditate on the four places of the entities of the four doors of liberation, and on the four bodies, having the nature of the four vajras, and having the form of the four syllables.🔽There, the upper place, having the form of a vajra jewel, is the source of the generation of the vajra body, like the autumn moon.🔽The left place, having the form of a half-moon, is the source of the generation of the sprout of the vajra speech, like a ruby jewel.

original: g-yas pa'i khyim yang zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa thugs kyi rdo rje'i lcug phran skyed par byed pa'i aindra n'i la lta bu'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i khyim yang zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa thugs kyi rdo rje'i lcug phran skyed par byed pa'i aindra n'i la lta bu'o //
translated: The right place, also having the form of a half-moon, is the source of the generation of the sprout of the vajra mind, like sapphire.

original: dbus kyi gnas ni chos 'byung ba'i rnam pa dam tshig rdo rje skye ba'i rgyu can rigs bzang po'i rdo rje snying po lta bu 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa chos thams cad kyi gzhir bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi gnas ni chos 'byung ba'i rnam pa dam tshig rdo rje skye ba'i rgyu can rigs bzang po'i rdo rje snying po lta bu 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa chos thams cad kyi gzhir bsam par bya'o //
translated: The central place is the form of the source of phenomena, the cause of the birth of the pledge vajra, like the essence of the vajra of a good family, endowed with five lights, which should be imagined as the basis of all phenomena.

original: de nas skad cig ma'i thig le rnams ni dga' ba'i thig le rnams la'o //
analyzed: de nas skad cig ma'i thig le rnams ni dga' ba'i thig le rnams la'o //
translated: Then, the momentary drops are in the drops of joy.

original: dga' ba'i thig le rnams ni dbang gi thig le rnams la'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i thig le rnams ni dbang gi thig le rnams la'o //
translated: The drops of joy are in the drops of power.

original: dbang gi thig le rnams ni sku rnams la zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang gi thig le rnams ni sku rnams la zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The drops of power should be meditated on as entering the bodies.

original: de'i rjes la sku bzhi pa gong nas gong du rim pa bzhin zhugs pa yang rgyu skar gyi sbyor ba lta bur dbus kyi thig le las zhu nas nang du thim par yid mnyam par gzhag par bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sku bzhi pa gong nas gong du rim pa bzhin zhugs pa yang rgyu skar gyi sbyor ba lta bur dbus kyi thig le las zhu nas nang du thim par yid mnyam par gzhag par bsam mo //
translated: After that, the four bodies, which have entered in sequence from above, also melt from the central drop like the conjunction of the lunar mansions and dissolve inside, and one should imagine equipoise.

original: de'i rjes la de nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs 'od zer gyi phreng ba rnam par 'phro ba can bdud rtsi'i char lta bu'i thig le'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la de nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs 'od zer gyi phreng ba rnam par 'phro ba can bdud rtsi'i char lta bu'i thig le'o //
translated: After that, that itself is the drop of the nectar-like rain of the form of the sphere of phenomena, radiating garlands of light rays.

original: thig ler zhugs pa'i chos kyi yi ge las n'a da'i skud pas bkug ste /
analyzed: thig ler zhugs pa'i chos kyi yi ge las n'a da'i skud pas bkug ste /
translated: Having drawn it up with the thread of nāda from the letter of the dharma that has entered the bindu,

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i rtsa'i lam nas steng du song nas chu dang 'o ma ltar chos dang thig le lhan cig tu ro gcig tu gyur pa dang / stong pa nyid dang snying rje mi phyed pa'i gzugs can 'jig rten las 'das pa lhan cig skyes pa phun sum tshogs pa rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i shugs ltar 'khor bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i rtsa'i lam nas steng du song nas chu dang 'o ma ltar chos dang thig le lhan cig tu ro gcig tu gyur pa dang / stong pa nyid dang snying rje mi phyed pa'i gzugs can 'jig rten las 'das pa lhan cig skyes pa phun sum tshogs pa rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i shugs ltar 'khor bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: having gone up through the path of the nāḍīs as described, the dharma and the bindu become of one taste, like water and milk, and the form of the inseparable emptiness and compassion, the transcendent, coemergent perfection, is meditated on as revolving like the momentum of a potter’s wheel.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las thig le sna tshogs gcig tu bsgom pa'i cho ga ste dang po'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las thig le sna tshogs gcig tu bsgom pa'i cho ga ste dang po'o /
translated: Those are the first of the various meditations on the bindu from the esoteric instructions of Nairātmya.

original: // / de nas sngar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sngags pas sngar brjod pa'i bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: // / de nas sngar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sngags pas sngar brjod pa'i bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
translated: Next, the mantrin who has the previously described characteristics should enter the previously described solitary hut and sit on a comfortable seat.

original: bsrung ba'i sngags brjod cing dkyil 'khor mchod pa la sogs pa yang byas la /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i sngags brjod cing dkyil 'khor mchod pa la sogs pa yang byas la /
translated: Reciting the protection mantra, he should also make offerings to the maṇḍala, and so on.

original: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha: @230a * //
analyzed: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha: @230a * //
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ🔽

original: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
analyzed: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ.

original: 'dis ni bdag med ma ru lhag par mos par bya'o //🔽de nas 'og gzhi shing rta'i yan lag can gyi chu skyes la gnas te srog song ba'i snying gar ri bong can gyi dkyil 'khor la sngon po 'am dmar nag gam dmar po lta bu gang 'dod pa ji skad gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag med ma'i
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag med ma ru lhag par mos par bya'o // de nas 'og gzhi shing rta'i yan lag can gyi chu skyes la gnas te srog song ba'i snying gar ri bong can gyi dkyil 'khor la sngon po 'am dmar nag gam dmar po lta bu gang 'dod pa ji skad gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag med ma'i
translated: By this, one should imagine oneself as Nairātmya.

original: rnam par bsgom par byas la /
analyzed: rnam par bsgom par byas la /
translated: Then, standing on the lotus with the chariot-part base, in the heart of the life-force, on the moon-mandala, one should meditate on the form of Nairātmya, blue, dark-red, or red as desired, with the characteristics as described,

original: ye shes dang mig dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang mig dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: and visualize the consecration of wisdom, eyes, body, and so forth.

original: de nas de'i 'og gzhi'i rtsibs can la dang po mchog gi snying po mtshan nyid nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin can /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og gzhi'i rtsibs can la dang po mchog gi snying po mtshan nyid nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin can /
translated: Then, on the base with spokes below that, the supreme essence at the beginning, with the nature of the space element,

original: mtshal dang 'da' di ma'i me tog lta bu gru gsum gyi 'khor lo la sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin stobs dang bral ba'i mgo bo'i dum bu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshal dang 'da' di ma'i me tog lta bu gru gsum gyi 'khor lo la sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin stobs dang bral ba'i mgo bo'i dum bu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize the head section, which is the nature of the earth element, devoid of strength, in the form of a triangular wheel, like the color of vermillion or the atimukta flower.

original: de'i nang du chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin 'o ma las skyes pa dkar po ril por bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i nang du chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin 'o ma las skyes pa dkar po ril por bsam mo //
translated: In its center, one should imagine the nature of the water element, white and solid, born from milk.

original: de nas de'i dbus su me'i khams kyi rang bzhin glog ltar 'khyug pa'i mtshon bsams la /
analyzed: de nas de'i dbus su me'i khams kyi rang bzhin glog ltar 'khyug pa'i mtshon bsams la /
translated: Then, in its center, one should imagine the nature of the fire element, like a lightning bolt, with the form of a weapon.

original: me'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa lte ba la rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin zla ba phyed pa 'bar ba bsam mo //
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa lte ba la rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin zla ba phyed pa 'bar ba bsam mo //
translated: Endowed with the maṇḍala of fire, one should visualize the nature of the wind element, in the form of a half-moon, blazing at the navel.

original: de'i steng du 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid zla ba phyed thig les rnam par brgyan pa'i sa bon dga' ba'i tshogs can 'od gsal bar blta'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid zla ba phyed thig les rnam par brgyan pa'i sa bon dga' ba'i tshogs can 'od gsal bar blta'o //
translated: Above that, one should see the seed syllable, which is the nature of the five elements, adorned with a half-moon and a drop, the possessor of a host of joys, luminous.

original: de nas me'i dkyil 'khor de la chags pa chen po ston pa gsal bar 'bar ba'i yi ge gsum bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas me'i dkyil 'khor de la chags pa chen po ston pa gsal bar 'bar ba'i yi ge gsum bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then, on that maṇḍala of fire, one should visualize the three syllables, blazing and luminous, the teacher of great passion.

original: de la steng gi grvar don gyi rnam par stong pa'i yid tsam du gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de la steng gi grvar don gyi rnam par stong pa'i yid tsam du gsal ba'o //
translated: In the upper corner is the mind alone, clear as the emptiness of the meaning.

original: g-yon gyi grvar yang dag par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa can no //
analyzed: g-yon gyi grvar yang dag par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa can no //
translated: In the left corner is the one who produces the fruit of the desired reality.

original: g-yas kyi grvar dgyes pa bskyed pa can no //
analyzed: g-yas kyi grvar dgyes pa bskyed pa can no //
translated: In the right corner is the one who produces the joy.

original: de dag kyang yi ge gsum ste sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug gi bde ba'i rgyur nges pa'i tshig tu grub par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang yi ge gsum ste sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug gi bde ba'i rgyur nges pa'i tshig tu grub par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Those are the three syllables, which should be understood as the definitive words for the cause of bliss in the beginning, the main practice, and the conclusion.

original: de nas de'i 'od zer gyis reg pa'i stobs kyis chags pa chen po'i rlung gis bskyod nas rjes su chags pa 'dod pa mo mtshon pa ltar /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'od zer gyis reg pa'i stobs kyis chags pa chen po'i rlung gis bskyod nas rjes su chags pa 'dod pa mo mtshon pa ltar /
translated: Then, by the power of being touched by the light rays, the great passion is stirred by the wind of great passion.🔽The seed syllable, which is like a very fine thread at the door of the house of insertion, is the form of the nāda with a bindu.

original: bcug pa'i khyim gyi sgor ba thag shin tu phra ba lta bu'i sa bon gyi yi ge thig le can n'a da'i ro ma'i gzugs steng du song yang rung ma mo ltar song ba ste /
analyzed: bcug pa'i khyim gyi sgor ba thag shin tu phra ba lta bu'i sa bon gyi yi ge thig le can n'a da'i ro ma'i gzugs steng du song yang rung ma mo ltar song ba ste /
translated: Whether it goes above or below, like a woman, it is the sign of passion.

original: yang 'khyog por 'gro bar mgrin pa'i khrod kyi bu ga'i phug ni khyim ste lce chung 'phyang ba'i rtser gnas pa dpal he ru ka'i ngo bo ham yig la bdag med mas reg par blta'o //
analyzed: yang 'khyog por 'gro bar mgrin pa'i khrod kyi bu ga'i phug ni khyim ste lce chung 'phyang ba'i rtser gnas pa dpal he ru ka'i ngo bo ham yig la bdag med mas reg par blta'o //
translated: Again, the cavity within the throat, which is the house of the crooked one, is the place where the tip of the hanging uvula is, and one should view it as touched by Nairātmya, the syllable haṃ, which is the essence of Śrī Heruka.

original: @230b de nas der reg pa'i bde ba rgyas pa'i bde ba can mi shigs pa'i thig le las 'thigs pa dri ma med cing dga' ba'i chu'i bdud rtsi char gyi snying po'i dbang bskur bas /
analyzed: @230b de nas der reg pa'i bde ba rgyas pa'i bde ba can mi shigs pa'i thig le las 'thigs pa dri ma med cing dga' ba'i chu'i bdud rtsi char gyi snying po'i dbang bskur bas /
translated: Then, the bliss of touching there, the bliss of expansion, from the indestructible drop, the essence of the rain of the nectar of the water of joy, the stainless stream,

original: yang dag par tshim pa dang dga' ba dang bcas shing lhag par dga' bas gang zhig myos pa ni 'phang lo bskor ba ltar bcom ldan 'das ma de lhun gyis grub par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par tshim pa dang dga' ba dang bcas shing lhag par dga' bas gang zhig myos pa ni 'phang lo bskor ba ltar bcom ldan 'das ma de lhun gyis grub par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: is the consecration of the essence of the rain, which is completely satisfying, delightful, and filled with supreme joy. One who is intoxicated, like a wheel that is turning, should meditate on that Bhagavatī spontaneously.

original: yang de'i rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pa dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can dang / thabs dang shes rab mi phyed pa'i bla ma dam pa'i man ngag las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de'i rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pa dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can dang / thabs dang shes rab mi phyed pa'i bla ma dam pa'i man ngag las rig par bya'o //
translated: Again, one should know from the instructions of the excellent guru, who is inseparable from the three vajras, who is the nature of the three bodies, and who is inseparable method and wisdom.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las 'byung ba chen po lnga dang rdo rje gsum dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can don dam pa'i yi ge'i gzugs kyis 'khor bar bsgom pa'i cho ga ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las 'byung ba chen po lnga dang rdo rje gsum dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can don dam pa'i yi ge'i gzugs kyis 'khor bar bsgom pa'i cho ga ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: Those are the ritual for meditating on cyclic existence with the form of the ultimate syllables, which have the nature of the five great elements, the three vajras, and the three bodies, as they occur in the Cakrasaṃvara Commentary.

original: // / de nas rnal 'byor bas ji lta ba de bzhin pas bgegs bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas rnal 'byor bas ji lta ba de bzhin pas bgegs bsal bar bya ste /
translated: Then the yogī should remove obstacles by means of the suchness mantra.

original: cho ga ni dben pa'i khyim la sogs par stan 'jam zhing bde bar 'dug ste bdag nyid bdag med mar mos par byas la dag pa'i sngags brjod do //
analyzed: cho ga ni dben pa'i khyim la sogs par stan 'jam zhing bde bar 'dug ste bdag nyid bdag med mar mos par byas la dag pa'i sngags brjod do //
translated: The ritual is as follows: Sitting on a soft, comfortable seat in an isolated house, and so on, one should imagine oneself as Nairātmya and recite the purification mantra.

original: 'og gzhi'i rtsibs dang ldan pa ni mya ngan me dang rgya skyegs shing dang ku su ma'i me tog lta bu la shing rta'i yan lag can gru gsum par sna tshogs rdo rje la chu skyes kyi ze'u 'brur zla ba'o //
analyzed: 'og gzhi'i rtsibs dang ldan pa ni mya ngan me dang rgya skyegs shing dang ku su ma'i me tog lta bu la shing rta'i yan lag can gru gsum par sna tshogs rdo rje la chu skyes kyi ze'u 'brur zla ba'o //
translated: The base below has spokes and is like a fire of misery, a palāśa tree, or a kusuma flower. The vajra cross is triangular, with a lotus pistil cup and moon on top.

original: der rdo rje rnon po rtse gcig pas 'og gi cha brgyan pa dbus kyi char sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa rab tu 'phyang ba sgra dang ldan pa dril bu'i phreng ba dang sna tshogs pa'i phreng ba dang ldan pa ske'i char ro //
analyzed: der rdo rje rnon po rtse gcig pas 'og gi cha brgyan pa dbus kyi char sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa rab tu 'phyang ba sgra dang ldan pa dril bu'i phreng ba dang sna tshogs pa'i phreng ba dang ldan pa ske'i char ro //
translated: In the lower part of that, adorned with a single sharp vajra point, in the central part, marked with a crossed vajra, hanging down, with sound, endowed with a garland of bells and a garland of various things, in the neck part,

original: steng gi char phul du byung ba'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pas mtshon pa langs nas gnas pa'i kha tv'am ga ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid bdag med ma'i ngo bor sa bon yongs su gyur pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: steng gi char phul du byung ba'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pas mtshon pa langs nas gnas pa'i kha tv'am ga ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid bdag med ma'i ngo bor sa bon yongs su gyur pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: in the upper part, marked with an excellent five-pointed vajra, standing up, the khaṭvāṅga should be seen as the nature of the realm of phenomena, the essence of Nairātmya, arisen from the complete transformation of the seed syllable.

original: de nas de'i 'og dang bar dang mgrin pa dang steng gi char las dang chos dang dam tshig dang phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo ni /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og dang bar dang mgrin pa dang steng gi char las dang chos dang dam tshig dang phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo ni /
translated: Then, below that, in the middle, throat, and upper parts, the nature of the karma, dharma, and great pledge seals,

original: chos kyi sgo dang drag po dang ye shes rgya mtsho dang mgo med do //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo dang drag po dang ye shes rgya mtsho dang mgo med do //
translated: are the dharma door, Rudra, ocean of wisdom, and headless.

original: de yang sna tshogs dang nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i kha dog tu rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de yang sna tshogs dang nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i kha dog tu rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: Moreover, one should visualize it as having various colors, black, red, and white.

original: nyi zla 'gags pa las skyes pa'i las kyi rlung gis bskul bas 'jig pa'i dus kyi me'i phung po shin tu 'bar ba ltar rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi zla 'gags pa las skyes pa'i las kyi rlung gis bskul bas 'jig pa'i dus kyi me'i phung po shin tu 'bar ba ltar rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize it as blazing like the mass of fire at the time of the destruction of the world, impelled by the karma-vāyu arisen from the obstruction of the sun and moon.

original: de nas de'i steng du gyur pa'i rdo rje'i dbus kyi ra'i rtse mo nas 'jig pa'i dus kyi me 'bar ba ltar langs pa dang / 'bar bas bsreg pa'i rnam par 'khrugs par bya ste /🔽'khor lo gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang rig @231a * //
analyzed: de nas de'i steng du gyur pa'i rdo rje'i dbus kyi ra'i rtse mo nas 'jig pa'i dus kyi me 'bar ba ltar langs pa dang / 'bar bas bsreg pa'i rnam par 'khrugs par bya ste / 'khor lo gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang rig @231a * //
translated: Then, from the tip of the ra in the center of the vajra above that, one should visualize the fire of the destruction of the world arising like a blazing fire, and the blazing fire should be agitated.

original: ma'i tshogs phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid du 'khor lo gsum bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo bde ba'i 'khor lor me 'bar bas mar zhu ba ltar yang dag par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i tshogs phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid du 'khor lo gsum bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo bde ba'i 'khor lor me 'bar bas mar zhu ba ltar yang dag par bsgom pa'o //
translated: The assembly of buddhas abiding in the cakra, the assembly of vidyās, and all tathāgatas of the ten directions should be visualized as the nature of the body, speech, mind, and gnosis of the three cakras, the nature of the essence of bliss, like the fire melting the butter.

original: de nas 'dzag pa'i bdud rtsi 'dzin pa gsos pa dang / sangs rgyas dang rig ma'i tshogs bsregs shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzugs can brlan pa yang ji ltar chu 'dzin gyi tshogs las chu 'bab pa'i thig les tshim pa ni rma bya myos pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dzag pa'i bdud rtsi 'dzin pa gsos pa dang / sangs rgyas dang rig ma'i tshogs bsregs shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzugs can brlan pa yang ji ltar chu 'dzin gyi tshogs las chu 'bab pa'i thig les tshim pa ni rma bya myos pa lta bu ste /
translated: Then, the nectar that is held in the dripping [channel] is restored, and the assembly of Buddhas and knowledge goddesses are satiated by the drops of water that fall from the mass of clouds, and the form of nirvana is moistened.

original: shin tu dga' bas gzhan gyi 'dod pas tshim pa bde ba chen por zhugs pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin las nam mkha'i khams thams cad du spros bas dga' ba'i tshogs kyis gdungs pa'i gar de /
analyzed: shin tu dga' bas gzhan gyi 'dod pas tshim pa bde ba chen por zhugs pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin las nam mkha'i khams thams cad du spros bas dga' ba'i tshogs kyis gdungs pa'i gar de /
translated: Like a peacock thrilled by the rain, the yogin, who is the nature of wisdom, is satisfied by the assembly of the host of the Buddhas, and enters into great bliss by satisfying others with his own desire.

original: der yid song ba'i sngags pas ji srid 'dod pa lhun gyis grub par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: der yid song ba'i sngags pas ji srid 'dod pa lhun gyis grub par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogin should meditate on the dance of the assembly of the host of the Buddhas, which is emanated into the whole realm of space, as long as he wishes, with the bliss of the great seal.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las shes rab mchog gi bdag nyid kha tv'am ga rol pa bsgom pa'i cho ga ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las shes rab mchog gi bdag nyid kha tv'am ga rol pa bsgom pa'i cho ga ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter of the instructions on Nairatmya, the meditation on the nature of the supreme wisdom, the play of Katvanga.

original: // / de nas rnal 'byor ma'i mtshan nyid gang du gsungs pas ji lta bu'i bsrung ba'i sngags bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas rnal 'byor ma'i mtshan nyid gang du gsungs pas ji lta bu'i bsrung ba'i sngags bya ste /
translated: Then, one should recite the mantra of protection, as taught in the Yoginī’s Manual.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'i khang pa la sogs pa ru stan bde ba la rdo rje skyil mo krung bsdams pas bdag med mar mos la rnam par dag pa'i sngags brjod do //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'i khang pa la sogs pa ru stan bde ba la rdo rje skyil mo krung bsdams pas bdag med mar mos la rnam par dag pa'i sngags brjod do //
translated: In a place free from disturbance, etc., on a comfortable seat, having bound the vajra posture, one should imagine oneself as Nairātmya and recite the pure mantra.

original: de nas sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su srog song ba'i sems kyi gzhir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sngar gsungs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid can gyi bdag med ma rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su srog song ba'i sems kyi gzhir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sngar gsungs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid can gyi bdag med ma rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: Then, in the center of the emanation wheel, in the foundation of the mind that has entered the life-force, on a moon disc, one should visualize Nairātmya with the previously described characteristics.

original: de'i 'og gzhi la shing rta'i yan lag can yongs su smin pa'i kimpa ka'i 'bras bu lta bu /
analyzed: de'i 'og gzhi la shing rta'i yan lag can yongs su smin pa'i kimpa ka'i 'bras bu lta bu /
translated: Below that, in the foundation, like a fully ripened kiṃśuka fruit,

original: de yang me'i 'khor lo gru gsum pa de'i nang du padma 'dab ma bzhi pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang me'i 'khor lo gru gsum pa de'i nang du padma 'dab ma bzhi pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should imagine a four-petaled lotus in the center of the triangular fire wheel.

original: de nas de'i 'dab ma dang ze 'brul mkha' 'gro ma lnga'i rang bzhin yungs kar phra mo'i bde ba'i thig ler bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i 'dab ma dang ze 'brul mkha' 'gro ma lnga'i rang bzhin yungs kar phra mo'i bde ba'i thig ler bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should meditate on the filaments and stamen as the nature of the five dakinis, as the drop of bliss of the subtle mustard seed.

original: de la shar phyogs kyi 'dab ma la me long lta bu'i ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin rab tu sbyor ba'i bde ba'i thig le'o //
analyzed: de la shar phyogs kyi 'dab ma la me long lta bu'i ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin rab tu sbyor ba'i bde ba'i thig le'o //
translated: There, on the eastern filament, is the drop of bliss of the application of the nature of mirror-like wisdom and the stage of buddhahood, the nature of Vajrī.

original: lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin dkar mo'i rang bzhin can rtsa ba'i bde ba'i thig le'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin dkar mo'i rang bzhin can rtsa ba'i bde ba'i thig le'o //
translated: On the southern filament, is the drop of root bliss, the nature of the wisdom of equality and the stage of buddhahood, the nature of white Gaurī.

original: nub phyogs kyi 'dab ma la so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin chu'i rnal 'byor ma'i bdag nyid can yongs su bcad pa'i bde ba'i thig le'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'dab ma la so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin chu'i rnal 'byor ma'i bdag nyid can yongs su bcad pa'i bde ba'i thig le'o //
translated: On the western filament, is the drop of bliss of the determination of the nature of discerning wisdom and the stage of buddhahood, the nature of the yoginī of water.

original: byang phyogs kyi 'dab ma la bya ba grub @231b pa'i ye shes dang / sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin can gyi don gyi bde ba'i thig le'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi 'dab ma la bya ba grub @231b pa'i ye shes dang / sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin can gyi don gyi bde ba'i thig le'o //
translated: On the petal in the north is the gnosis of successful activities, and the drop of ultimate bliss, which is the nature of the Buddha ground and the nature of Vajraḍāka.

original: ze'u 'bru la shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin bdag med ma'i rang bzhin can chos thams cad don dam pa mchog tu bde ba'i thig ler yid mnyam par bzhag pa'i sngags pas dus ring por bsam mo
analyzed: ze'u 'bru la shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang sangs rgyas sa'i rang bzhin bdag med ma'i rang bzhin can chos thams cad don dam pa mchog tu bde ba'i thig ler yid mnyam par bzhag pa'i sngags pas dus ring por bsam mo
translated: On the stamen is the gnosis of the utterly pure sphere of reality, and the drop of ultimate bliss of all phenomena, which is the nature of the Buddha ground and the nature of Nairātmya. The mantrin should visualize this for a long time, with his mind in meditative equipoise.

original: // de'i rjes la dbus kyi thig le las rnam par spros te dri ma med pa'i brgyad kyi phyed kyi 'od zer lcags kyu rnams kyis phyogs kyi thig le bkug pa rnams kyang dbus kyi thig le la zhugs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: // de'i rjes la dbus kyi thig le las rnam par spros te dri ma med pa'i brgyad kyi phyed kyi 'od zer lcags kyu rnams kyis phyogs kyi thig le bkug pa rnams kyang dbus kyi thig le la zhugs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: After that, he should visualize that the light rays in the form of hooks emanate from the drop in the center and draw in the drops in the directions, which then enter the drop in the center.

original: de nas ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can don dam pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin du thig le'i gtso bo 'bar bar ji tsam 'dod pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nas ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can don dam pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin du thig le'i gtso bo 'bar bar ji tsam 'dod pa bsgom mo //
translated: Then, one should meditate on the blazing of the principal bindu, which has the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, as the nature of ultimate wisdom, for as long as one wishes.

original: de nas 'od zer dmar po byung ba ni dpag bsam gyi shing gi yal ga ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don bskyed cing /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer dmar po byung ba ni dpag bsam gyi shing gi yal ga ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don bskyed cing /
translated: Then, the arising of red light rays, like the branches of a wish-fulfilling tree, generates the desired object.

original: skyed par byed pa'i me ltar bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i me ltar bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Like a fire that generates heat, it generates bliss.

original: de nas sna'i rtse mo'i gtsug tor du khyer la dus ring mor bde bar gnas par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sna'i rtse mo'i gtsug tor du khyer la dus ring mor bde bar gnas par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should carry it to the uṣṇīṣa at the tip of the nose and imagine that one remains blissful for a long time.

original: de nas de'i thig le ba thag ltar rang las byung ba'i skud pa'i ri mo'i rgyun gyis skas kyi khrem gnyer gyi lam la song ba dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ri bong can gyi dkyil 'khor ltar bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha' ma lus par khyab ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i thig le ba thag ltar rang las byung ba'i skud pa'i ri mo'i rgyun gyis skas kyi khrem gnyer gyi lam la song ba dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ri bong can gyi dkyil 'khor ltar bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha' ma lus par khyab ste /
translated: Like the mandala of the moon, the host of light rays that are the nature of nectar pervades the entire sky.

original: mchog tu bde ba'i rang bzhin dang chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid dang bdag med ma'i rang bzhin du sna'i rtse mor gnas par gyur cing 'bar ba dang bsgom par bya ba dang sgom par byed pa dang bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i skyon gyis byugs pa dang bral
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba'i rang bzhin dang chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid dang bdag med ma'i rang bzhin du sna'i rtse mor gnas par gyur cing 'bar ba dang bsgom par bya ba dang sgom par byed pa dang bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i skyon gyis byugs pa dang bral
translated: The nature of supreme bliss, the nature of the dharmakāya, and the nature of Nairātmya, one should meditate on the mantra that abides at the tip of the nose, free from the faults of the concepts of the one who meditates, the meditation, and the object of meditation, and free from the faults of the stains of blazing.

original: bar gyur pa'i sngags pas ci tsam brtan par nus pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bar gyur pa'i sngags pas ci tsam brtan par nus pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The mantra practitioner should meditate for as long as one is able to be stable.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las mchog tu bde ba'i thig le bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las mchog tu bde ba'i thig le bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: These are the four rites of meditation on the drop of supreme bliss from the instructions of Nairātmya.

original: // / de nas sngags pa dbang dang dam tshig dang ldan zhing snying rje la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas tshogs bsags te /
analyzed: // / de nas sngags pa dbang dang dam tshig dang ldan zhing snying rje la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas tshogs bsags te /
translated: Then, the mantrin who is endowed with the initiations and the commitments and endowed with the qualities of compassion and so forth, having accumulated the collections,

original: yid dang mthun pa'i phyogs su sngags pas stan la 'dug ste /🔽bsrung ba dang dkyil @232a * //
analyzed: yid dang mthun pa'i phyogs su sngags pas stan la 'dug ste / bsrung ba dang dkyil @232a * //
translated: in a place that is agreeable to the mind, the mantrin should sit on a seat,

original: 'khor mchod pa'i cho gas bdag nyid bdag nyid bdag med mar mos la /
analyzed: 'khor mchod pa'i cho gas bdag nyid bdag nyid bdag med mar mos la /
translated: and by the rite of the protection and the maṇḍala offerings, he should imagine himself as Nairātmya.

original: rang gi sprul pa'i rtsibs dang ldan par bdag med ma sngar bskyed pa gsungs pa bzhin bskyed la /
analyzed: rang gi sprul pa'i rtsibs dang ldan par bdag med ma sngar bskyed pa gsungs pa bzhin bskyed la /
translated: As previously stated, he should generate Nairātmya endowed with the emanation spokes.

original: de'i lte ba la me tog manda ra ba kha phye ba lta bu gru gsum pa thub pa'i dbang po'i gnas mchog tu lhag par yum dang bcas pa dang / dang po'i mchog gi rang bzhin can 'od gsal bar bcu drug cha zhag gi gtso bo dang /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la me tog manda ra ba kha phye ba lta bu gru gsum pa thub pa'i dbang po'i gnas mchog tu lhag par yum dang bcas pa dang / dang po'i mchog gi rang bzhin can 'od gsal bar bcu drug cha zhag gi gtso bo dang /
translated: In her navel, like an open mandārava flower, is a triangle, the supreme abode of the Lord of Sages, endowed with the mother, the nature of the supreme first [buddha], clear light, and the principal of the sixteen parts of the day.

original: rta bdun pa'i ri'i phur pa ltar kha sbyor du gsal bar blta'o //
analyzed: rta bdun pa'i ri'i phur pa ltar kha sbyor du gsal bar blta'o //
translated: One should see the two lotuses as joined like the peak of Mount Meru.

original: de las byung ba'i yongs su rtsom pa dang so sor 'byed pa dang rnam par spyod pa rnams su ston pa khab lta bu shin tu rno ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer ltar phra ba lta bu shin tu dmar po de kha sbyor lan gsum du dgrol te der
analyzed: de las byung ba'i yongs su rtsom pa dang so sor 'byed pa dang rnam par spyod pa rnams su ston pa khab lta bu shin tu rno ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer ltar phra ba lta bu shin tu dmar po de kha sbyor lan gsum du dgrol te der
translated: From that, the teacher arises in the form of a needle, very sharp, like the light rays of the sun, very red, and very fine, like a spider’s thread.

original: nang du song bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: nang du song bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the needle enters the two lotuses and separates the two lips of the bhaga.

original: de nas de'i sbyor ba las skyes pa ni 'bar zhing dga' ba las bskyed pa skye ba can lta bu'i rgyal ba rnams don dam pa'i ye shes kyi thig le rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i sbyor ba las skyes pa ni 'bar zhing dga' ba las bskyed pa skye ba can lta bu'i rgyal ba rnams don dam pa'i ye shes kyi thig le rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, the ultimate wisdom drop of the victors, generated from the union of the two, should be imagined.

original: de nas de las byung pa ni sprul pa'i ri mo'i rang bzhin lha'i dbang po yang dbang phyug bde ba la dmigs pa'i mchog gzhan gyi don byed pa ni glang po che mo ltar rol zhing sgeg par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de nas de las byung pa ni sprul pa'i ri mo'i rang bzhin lha'i dbang po yang dbang phyug bde ba la dmigs pa'i mchog gzhan gyi don byed pa ni glang po che mo ltar rol zhing sgeg par 'gro ba ste /
translated: Then, from that, the supreme lord of the gods, who is the nature of the emanation of the lines, who is engaged in the welfare of others, who is focused on bliss, moves about like an elephant, playing and dancing.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dmar po'i thur ma phra mo ltar ring bas s'a la'i yal ga lta bu legs par 'bar ba bdag med ma'i gzugs brnyan gyis bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i dpal dgyes pa'i
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dmar po'i thur ma phra mo ltar ring bas s'a la'i yal ga lta bu legs par 'bar ba bdag med ma'i gzugs brnyan gyis bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i dpal dgyes pa'i
translated: It is long like a fine red wish-fulfilling gem, well ablaze like a branch of a sāla tree. In the center of the great-bliss chakra, it abides as the form of Nairātmya, the glory of the gathering of all tathāgatas.🔽

original: rdo rje'i bdag nyid mgo med kyi gzugs kyi bcom ldan 'das kyi lus la reg par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag nyid mgo med kyi gzugs kyi bcom ldan 'das kyi lus la reg par bsam par bya'o //
translated: The tip of the vajra is long like a thin red wish-fulfilling gem, and well ablaze like a branch of the Sāla tree. Imagine that it touches the body of the Bhagavān, whose form is headless, the nature of Vajrasattva, abiding in the center of the great-bliss chakra, the glory of the gathering of all tathāgatas, the joy of all buddhas.

original: de nas de dag dga' bas bskyod pas gzugs brnyan reg pa las byung ba'i chags pas zhu bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de dag dga' bas bskyod pas gzugs brnyan reg pa las byung ba'i chags pas zhu bar gyur te /
translated: Then, by their shaking with joy, the image melts through passion born of contact,

original: dga' ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshul gyis 'bab cing rjes su 'gro ba'i thig le'i gzugs can dga' ba'i 'dod pa bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshul gyis 'bab cing rjes su 'gro ba'i thig le'i gzugs can dga' ba'i 'dod pa bsten par bya'o //
translated: and one should enjoy the desire of joy, which has the form of a drop that falls and follows in accordance with the mode of joy.

original: de yang de'i sbyor ba las yang dag par byung ba'i bde ba'i bdud rtsi myangs pa bcud dang / stobs su smin pas rgyas pa las spro zhing ma rgud cing legs pa mchog gi dga' ba tshogs bsdu ba byas pas /
analyzed: de yang de'i sbyor ba las yang dag par byung ba'i bde ba'i bdud rtsi myangs pa bcud dang / stobs su smin pas rgyas pa las spro zhing ma rgud cing legs pa mchog gi dga' ba tshogs bsdu ba byas pas /
translated: Furthermore, having tasted the nectar of bliss that arises from the yoga, the “nutriment” is the expansion from the ripening of strength, the “increase” is the excellent, supreme joy, and the “gathering of the assembly” is the non-degeneration.

original: nam mkha'i phyogs ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba de yid gtad pa'i sngags @232b pas ji tsam nus pa de tsam du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba de yid gtad pa'i sngags @232b pas ji tsam nus pa de tsam du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should meditate for as long as one can on the mantra that focuses the mind on all the animate and inanimate that exist in all directions of space.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las ye shes kyi thig le bsgom pa'i cho ga ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las ye shes kyi thig le bsgom pa'i cho ga ste lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter on the method of meditating on the bindu of gnosis from the Instructions of Nairātmya.

original: // / de nas bsam gtan gyi khang par bde bar 'dug pas bya ba dag byas nas /
analyzed: // / de nas bsam gtan gyi khang par bde bar 'dug pas bya ba dag byas nas /
translated: Then, having performed the activities in a comfortable position in the house of concentration,

original: rnal 'byor ma'i mtshan nyid ji skad gsungs pa'i bdag med ma'i rnal 'byor can gyis sngar gsungs pa'i sprul pa'i 'khor lo la a'a li bsdus pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs can chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi tshul can /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i mtshan nyid ji skad gsungs pa'i bdag med ma'i rnal 'byor can gyis sngar gsungs pa'i sprul pa'i 'khor lo la a'a li bsdus pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs can chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi tshul can /
translated: The yogin of Nairātmya, who has the characteristics of a yoginī as previously described, should visualize the form of emptiness, which is the nature of the reality body, the nature of wisdom, and the nature of the form of the collection of the vowels, at the emanation wheel previously described.

original: rnal 'byor ma ma lus pa'i bsdus pa'i tshul can gzugs bdag med ma aom yig 'bar ba mngon par blta'o //🔽chos kyi 'khor lor gnas pa yang k'a li bsdus pa'i gzugs can longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid thabs kyi ngo bo snying rje'i tshul can te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ma lus pa'i bsdus pa'i tshul can gzugs bdag med ma aom yig 'bar ba mngon par blta'o // chos kyi 'khor lor gnas pa yang k'a li bsdus pa'i gzugs can longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid thabs kyi ngo bo snying rje'i tshul can te /
translated: He should visualize the form of emptiness, which is the nature of the form of the collection of all yoginīs, the emptiness of the form of Nairātmya, the blazing syllable oṃ.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i rang bzhin dpal he ru ka'i ngo bo h'um yig 'bar ba rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i rang bzhin dpal he ru ka'i ngo bo h'um yig 'bar ba rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: He should visualize the blazing syllable hūṃ, which is the nature of the glorious Heruka, the nature of the collection of all tathāgatas, at the dharma wheel, which is the nature of the enjoyment body, the nature of method, the nature of compassion, and the nature of the form of the collection of the consonants.

original: de nas de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba pho nya mo lta bus gnyi ga'i 'dod pa'i don nyi ma lta bu bsgrub pas bkug ste /🔽de nyid du rjes su chags pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nas de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba pho nya mo lta bus gnyi ga'i 'dod pa'i don nyi ma lta bu bsgrub pas bkug ste / de nyid du rjes su chags pa bsgom mo //
translated: Then, the garland of light rays that arise from that, like a messenger, summons the object of desire of both, like the sun, and one should meditate on passion right there.

original: de nas yang der sbyor ba'i rjes su chags pa dang shin tu zhen pa de dang mi phyed pa'i ze'u 'bru rin po che rtse mor phyin cing gnas par dus ring por bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang der sbyor ba'i rjes su chags pa dang shin tu zhen pa de dang mi phyed pa'i ze'u 'bru rin po che rtse mor phyin cing gnas par dus ring por bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, again, one should meditate for a long time on the union with her, the passion, and the intense attachment, the stamen that is inseparable from that, which has reached the tip of the jewel and abides there.

original: de nas de'i rjes la ma na sa'i gnas shing rta drang srong rta bdun pa cher 'tsher ba'i stobs las byung ba'i rlung dang / me'i sbyor bas zhu bar gyur pa dang / dngos po thams cad kyi stong pa yang dag pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de nas de'i rjes la ma na sa'i gnas shing rta drang srong rta bdun pa cher 'tsher ba'i stobs las byung ba'i rlung dang / me'i sbyor bas zhu bar gyur pa dang / dngos po thams cad kyi stong pa yang dag pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: After that, by the application of the wind and fire that arise from the power of the great brilliance of the seven horses of the sun in the place of the navel, one should meditate on the melting and the emptiness of all things, which is the emptiness of reality.

original: snying rje mi phyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems rnal 'byor pa rang gi mtshan nyid bum pa bzang po ltar 'dod pa'i don thams cad grub pa rnam par spros te /
analyzed: snying rje mi phyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems rnal 'byor pa rang gi mtshan nyid bum pa bzang po ltar 'dod pa'i don thams cad grub pa rnam par spros te /
translated: The yogi/nī who desires the non-dual mind of enlightenment, the nature of compassion, like an excellent vase, should imagine that all desired aims are accomplished.

original: bde ba'i rgyun du mnyam par snang bar byas pas snang ba dang ni snang ba sems can ma lus pa snod du byas pa thig le'i gzugs der yid song ba'i sngags pas bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyun du mnyam par snang bar byas pas snang ba dang ni snang ba sems can ma lus pa snod du byas pa thig le'i gzugs der yid song ba'i sngags pas bsam par bya'o //
translated: The appearance is the appearance of the equality of the stream of bliss. The mantra practitioner should imagine that the mind has gone into that form of the bindu, which is the universal vessel of all sentient beings.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las lhan cig skyes pa'i yi ge mi 'gyur ba'i thig ler bsgom pa'i cho ga ste drug pa'o /🔽// / de nas bdag med ma'i rnal @233a * //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las lhan cig skyes pa'i yi ge mi 'gyur ba'i thig ler bsgom pa'i cho ga ste drug pa'o / // / de nas bdag med ma'i rnal @233a * //
translated: These are the instructions on Nairātmya, the sixth chapter on the rite of meditation on the unchanging bindu of the co-emergent syllable.

original: 'byor pas sngar bzhin pa'i sprul pa'i 'khor lo la bdag med mar yid kyis bskyed la /
analyzed: 'byor pas sngar bzhin pa'i sprul pa'i 'khor lo la bdag med mar yid kyis bskyed la /
translated: Then, the yogi/nī of Nairātmya, as before, mentally generates Nairātmya in the emanation cakra.

original: de yang sprul pa'i 'khor lor padma 'dab ma nang du bzhi phyir bcu bsgom mo //
analyzed: de yang sprul pa'i 'khor lor padma 'dab ma nang du bzhi phyir bcu bsgom mo //
translated: Moreover, one should meditate on the lotus in the emanation cakra with four petals inside and ten petals outside.

original: de nas de'i ze 'brul rnam par shes pa yid zhe sdang sangs rgyas kyi sa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can bdag med ma'i ngo bo dbyangs yig dang po thig le dang bcas pa rnam par bsgoms pa 'dab ma dag la de
analyzed: de nas de'i ze 'brul rnam par shes pa yid zhe sdang sangs rgyas kyi sa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can bdag med ma'i ngo bo dbyangs yig dang po thig le dang bcas pa rnam par bsgoms pa 'dab ma dag la de
translated: Then, on its anthers, one should visualize the first vowel [a] together with a drop, which is the nature of the consciousness element, the mind, the buddha ground of the utterly pure exalted wisdom, and the essence of Nairātmya.

original: las spros pa ni rnal 'byor ma bcu bzhi'i rang bzhin can dbyangs yig bcu bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: las spros pa ni rnal 'byor ma bcu bzhi'i rang bzhin can dbyangs yig bcu bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The emanations from that are the fourteen vowels, which have the nature of the fourteen yoginīs, that one should visualize on the petals.

original: de la nang gi shar phyogs kyi 'dab ma la gzugs mig gti mug sangs rgyas kyis me long lta bu'i bdag nyid rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin dbyangs yig gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi shar phyogs kyi 'dab ma la gzugs mig gti mug sangs rgyas kyis me long lta bu'i bdag nyid rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin dbyangs yig gnyis pa'o //
translated: On the inner petals, on the petal in the east, the form element, the eye, delusion, the buddha mirror-like exalted wisdom, the nature of Vajrī, is the second vowel [ā].

original: lho ru tshor ba sna nga rgyal sangs rgyas kyis mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid dkar mo'i dbyangs yig gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lho ru tshor ba sna nga rgyal sangs rgyas kyis mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid dkar mo'i dbyangs yig gsum pa'o //
translated: In the south, the feeling element, the nose, pride, the buddha exalted wisdom of equality, the nature of Pāṇḍaravāsinī, is the third vowel [i].

original: nub tu 'du shes lce 'dod chags sangs rgyas kyi so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid chu'i rnal 'byor ma ngo bo dbyangs yig bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu 'du shes lce 'dod chags sangs rgyas kyi so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid chu'i rnal 'byor ma ngo bo dbyangs yig bzhi pa'o //
translated: In the west, perception, tongue, passion, the Buddha, the nature of discrimination, the water-yoginī, the essence of the four vowels.

original: byang du 'du byed lus phrag dog sangs rgyas kyi bya ba grub pa'i bdag nyid can rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i ngo bo dbyangs yig lnga pa'o //
analyzed: byang du 'du byed lus phrag dog sangs rgyas kyi bya ba grub pa'i bdag nyid can rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i ngo bo dbyangs yig lnga pa'o //
translated: In the north, compositional factors, body, envy, the Buddha, the nature of successful activities, the essence of the vajra-ḍākinī, the five vowels.

original: phyi rol gyi dbang ldan du dga' ba la sogs pas gsum gyi bdag nyid can spos mo'i rnag bzhin can dbyangs yig drug pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dbang ldan du dga' ba la sogs pas gsum gyi bdag nyid can spos mo'i rnag bzhin can dbyangs yig drug pa'o //
translated: In the outer northeast, the nature of the three, joy and so on, the nature of the incense goddess, the six vowels.

original: me'i mtshams su 'od 'phro ba la sogs pas gsum gyi bdag nyid can ri khrod ma'i rang bzhin dbyang yig bdun pa'o //
analyzed: me'i mtshams su 'od 'phro ba la sogs pas gsum gyi bdag nyid can ri khrod ma'i rang bzhin dbyang yig bdun pa'o //
translated: In the southeast, the nature of the three, radiance and so on, the nature of the khaḍga goddess, the seven vowels.

original: bden bral du ring du song ba dang mig g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can gtum mo'i ngo bo dbyangs yig brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bden bral du ring du song ba dang mig g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can gtum mo'i ngo bo dbyangs yig brgyad pa'o //
translated: In the southwest, the nature of the three, far-reaching and moving eyes, the nature of the caṇḍālī goddess, the eight vowels.

original: rlung legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin gyi bdag nyid can g-yung mo'i ngo bo dbyangs yig dgu pa'o //
analyzed: rlung legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin gyi bdag nyid can g-yung mo'i ngo bo dbyangs yig dgu pa'o //
translated: The wind is the nature of the excellent intelligence and the cloud of Dharma, the essence of the Yoginī, the ninth vowel [i].

original: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma la dad pa la sogs pa dbang po bzhi'i bdag nyid can sgo skyong gi ngo bo dbyangs yig bcu pa bcu gcig pa bcu gnyis pa bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma la dad pa la sogs pa dbang po bzhi'i bdag nyid can sgo skyong gi ngo bo dbyangs yig bcu pa bcu gcig pa bcu gnyis pa bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: On the petals in the east, etc., are the four faculties of faith, etc., the nature of the four door-guardians, the tenth, eleventh, twelfth, and thirteenth vowels [u ū ṛ ṝ].

original: nub dang bden bral gyi mtshams su reg pa dang shes rab dang dbang pa'i bdag nyid can sa spyod ma'i rang bzhin dbyangs yig bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nub dang bden bral gyi mtshams su reg pa dang shes rab dang dbang pa'i bdag nyid can sa spyod ma'i rang bzhin dbyangs yig bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: In the southwest is the faculty of sensation, the nature of the faculty of wisdom, the fourteenth vowel [e].

original: dbang ldan dang shar gyi mtshams su chos dang dad pa la sogs pa stobs lnga'i bdag nyid can mkha' spyod ma'i ngo bo dbyangs yig bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan dang shar gyi mtshams su chos dang dad pa la sogs pa stobs lnga'i bdag nyid can mkha' spyod ma'i ngo bo dbyangs yig bco lnga pa'o //
translated: In the northeast is the faculty of Dharma, the nature of the five powers of faith, etc., the fifteenth vowel [ai].

original: dbyangs yig de dag kyang 'od gsal ba bdud rtsi'i char bab par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs yig de dag kyang 'od gsal ba bdud rtsi'i char bab par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that those vowels are the rain of the nectar of clear light.

original: de nas dbyangs yig dang @233b po 'od zer gyi phreng bas khyab ste lhag pa'i 'od zer skar mda'i rnam pas rnyed par rab tu blta'o //
analyzed: de nas dbyangs yig dang @233b po 'od zer gyi phreng bas khyab ste lhag pa'i 'od zer skar mda'i rnam pas rnyed par rab tu blta'o //
translated: Then, the vowels and the first [consonant] are pervaded by a garland of light rays, and one should clearly see the excellent light rays in the form of a shooting star.

original: de nas nyi ma'i 'od dmar po spros pas mthong bas gsal te tho rangs kyi skar ma ltar thim par dbyangs yig bcu bzhi po de dag rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i 'od dmar po spros pas mthong bas gsal te tho rangs kyi skar ma ltar thim par dbyangs yig bcu bzhi po de dag rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: Then, the red light of the sun is emitted, and one sees the clarity, and the fourteen vowels dissolve like the stars at dawn.

original: dang po dbyangs yig kyang nyin mos 'jigs pa ltar thig le phug tu zhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: dang po dbyangs yig kyang nyin mos 'jigs pa ltar thig le phug tu zhugs par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that the first vowel also enters into the hole of the bindu, as if afraid of the sun.

original: de yang thig le phug gi bur par zhugs pa dang nyi ma'i 'od kyis gdungs pas bsreg par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang thig le phug gi bur par zhugs pa dang nyi ma'i 'od kyis gdungs pas bsreg par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should imagine that it enters into the hole of the bindu, and is burned by the heat of the sun's light.

original: n'a da ring po legs pa'i dbyangs yig rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: n'a da ring po legs pa'i dbyangs yig rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine the excellent vowel of the long nāda.

original: de nas de'i n'a das bskul bas sngags dang khyu mchog gi rva yis brdungs pas zhu ba thag pa 'phyang ba ltar ngang pa skyugs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i n'a das bskul bas sngags dang khyu mchog gi rva yis brdungs pas zhu ba thag pa 'phyang ba ltar ngang pa skyugs pa ste /
translated: Then, one should imagine that the nāda is urged by that, and is struck by the mantra and the horn of the bull, and like a hanging rope, it is vomited by the goose.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rlung gis bskyod pa tsha bas gdungs pa zhi ba ltar don dam par mchog gi gzugs las rnam par 'phros te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rlung gis bskyod pa tsha bas gdungs pa zhi ba ltar don dam par mchog gi gzugs las rnam par 'phros te /
translated: Just as the heat of the wind that is generated by the coemergent wind is pacified, in the same way, the supreme form is emanated from the ultimate.

original: bde ba chen po'i rgyun gyis srid pa ma lus pa la khyab pa der song ba'i yid can gyi sngags pas ji tsam nus pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rgyun gyis srid pa ma lus pa la khyab pa der song ba'i yid can gyi sngags pas ji tsam nus pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The mantra practitioner whose mind has gone there should meditate for as long as possible on the pervasion of the entire world by the stream of great bliss.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las yi ge cha'i sbyor ba thig ler bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bdun pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las yi ge cha'i sbyor ba thig ler bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventh chapter of the instructions of Nairātmya on the meditation on the drop through the union with the letter ca.

original: // / de nas mtshan nyid ji lta ba brjod pa'i sngags pas sngar gsungs pa'i bya ba thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas mtshan nyid ji lta ba brjod pa'i sngags pas sngar gsungs pa'i bya ba thams cad bya ste /
translated: Then, the mantra practitioner who has described the characteristics should perform all the previously mentioned activities.

original: bdag nyid bdag med mar mos shing sprul pa'i 'khor lo la mchog gi thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid zla ba nyi ma'i sbyor ba las yang dag par byung ba rlung med pa'i mar me mi g-yo ba ltar gyen du 'bar bas mun pa'i tshogs ma lus
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag med mar mos shing sprul pa'i 'khor lo la mchog gi thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid zla ba nyi ma'i sbyor ba las yang dag par byung ba rlung med pa'i mar me mi g-yo ba ltar gyen du 'bar bas mun pa'i tshogs ma lus
translated: One should imagine oneself as Nairātmya and the supreme method and wisdom that arise from the union of the moon and sun in the emanation cakra, blazing upward like an unshakable lamp in a windless place,

original: pa zhi zhing yul dang dbang po'i grong khyer bsregs te /
analyzed: pa zhi zhing yul dang dbang po'i grong khyer bsregs te /
translated: The town of the objects and senses is burned.

original: gzhan gyi rnal 'byor ma rab tu 'jug pa yang 'gog cing rnam par rtog pa nyung ba ma yin pa zad par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnal 'byor ma rab tu 'jug pa yang 'gog cing rnam par rtog pa nyung ba ma yin pa zad par byed de /
translated: The entry of other yoginis is blocked and the non-decrease of the small concepts is destroyed.🔽The mass of dry branches of the mass of the fire of wisdom is blazing.

original: shing skam po'i yal ga'i tshogs la phul du gyur pa'i shes rab me'i tshogs su 'bar bas yang bdag med ma'i rang bzhin gtum mo ltar mi reg pa gtum zhing rab tu gtum pa blta'o //
analyzed: shing skam po'i yal ga'i tshogs la phul du gyur pa'i shes rab me'i tshogs su 'bar bas yang bdag med ma'i rang bzhin gtum mo ltar mi reg pa gtum zhing rab tu gtum pa blta'o //
translated: Again, one should see the nature of Nairatmya as fierce and very fierce, not touching like candali.

original: de yang yid chags par gyur pa dang bde ba'i 'khor lo nam mkhar gnas pa'i ngang pa phye ma le ba ltar legs par snum zhing mar khu'i mer snang ba'i sred pas blta ba dang chags pas zhu ste der thim par rnam par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang yid chags par gyur pa dang bde ba'i 'khor lo nam mkhar gnas pa'i ngang pa phye ma le ba ltar legs par snum zhing mar khu'i mer snang ba'i sred pas blta ba dang chags pas zhu ste der thim par rnam par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, when the mind is passionate, the wheel of bliss is in the sky, like a swan, well-oiled, appearing like a lamp of ghee. One should see it with craving and melt with passion, dissolving there.

original: de nas de'i me la mar bcug pa ltar rab tu 'bar zhing sdig pa dang nyon mongs pas gdungs pa ma lus pa bsal te rnam par spros pas bde ba chen po rgyas par spro ba gzer ltar dmigs pa thams cad zhi ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i me la mar bcug pa ltar rab tu 'bar zhing sdig pa dang nyon mongs pas gdungs pa ma lus pa bsal te rnam par spros pas bde ba chen po rgyas par spro ba gzer ltar dmigs pa thams cad zhi ste /
translated: Then, like pouring oil on a fire, it blazes up, removing all the torments of sin and afflictions, and spreading out, it expands great bliss.

original: @234a * // mi dmigs pa dang bsam du med pa dang brjod du med par gyur te der ci nus tsam gyi bar du bsgom mo //
analyzed: @234a * // mi dmigs pa dang bsam du med pa dang brjod du med par gyur te der ci nus tsam gyi bar du bsgom mo //
translated: The piercing of all visualizations is pacified, and one meditates on that non-observation, non-conceptuality, and inexpressibility for as long as one can.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las gtum zhing rab tu gtum pa'i chog ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las gtum zhing rab tu gtum pa'i chog ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: Those are the instructions on Nairātmya’s fierce and very fierce rites, the eighth.

original: // / de nas sngags pa dbang dang ldan pas sngar gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi khang par stan bde ba la 'dug nas bsrung ba dang dkyil 'khor mchod pa la sogs pa'i cho ga byas la /
analyzed: // / de nas sngags pa dbang dang ldan pas sngar gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi khang par stan bde ba la 'dug nas bsrung ba dang dkyil 'khor mchod pa la sogs pa'i cho ga byas la /
translated: Then, the powerful mantra practitioner, having sat on a comfortable seat in the previously described meditation chamber, should perform the rite of protection, the maṇḍala offerings, and so on.

original: rang gi lus nyid sa dang pha rol tu pha phyin pa bsdus pa'i rang bzhin gnas la sogs pa bsdus te /
analyzed: rang gi lus nyid sa dang pha rol tu pha phyin pa bsdus pa'i rang bzhin gnas la sogs pa bsdus te /
translated: One’s body itself is the nature of the perfection of wisdom, and so on, gathered into the nature of the perfection of generosity.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs 'bar ba nor bu'i rang bzhin thar pa chen po khang pa'i gzhal yas khang du rang gi lus nyid mos par byas la /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs 'bar ba nor bu'i rang bzhin thar pa chen po khang pa'i gzhal yas khang du rang gi lus nyid mos par byas la /
translated: One should imagine one’s own body as the palace of the great liberation, the nature of a jewel blazing with various forms.

original: der gnas pa'i rtsa kun yang dag par brten pa'i rtsa gsum pa ni bdag med mar mos so //
analyzed: der gnas pa'i rtsa kun yang dag par brten pa'i rtsa gsum pa ni bdag med mar mos so //
translated: One should imagine the three channels, which are the channels that support all the channels, as Nairātmya.

original: de la mgrin pa na brtsams te g-yon na gnas pa'i kha 'og tu bltas nas lte ba'i 'khor lor song zhing chu 'bab brkyang ma zhes bya ba'i rtsa ste /
analyzed: de la mgrin pa na brtsams te g-yon na gnas pa'i kha 'og tu bltas nas lte ba'i 'khor lor song zhing chu 'bab brkyang ma zhes bya ba'i rtsa ste /
translated: Beginning at the throat, the channel on the left, facing downward, is called the “extended water,” which goes to the navel cakra.

original: sku dang zla ba dang a'a li dang stong pa nyid dang lam du 'jug pa dang mtshan mo dang nub pa dang byang du rgyu ba rmi lam dang gzung ba dang shes bya dang don dam pa dang phra ba dang ae yig dang dngos po med pas bsdus
analyzed: sku dang zla ba dang a'a li dang stong pa nyid dang lam du 'jug pa dang mtshan mo dang nub pa dang byang du rgyu ba rmi lam dang gzung ba dang shes bya dang don dam pa dang phra ba dang ae yig dang dngos po med pas bsdus
translated: It is included by the body, the moon, the letter ā, emptiness, entering the path, night, the west, moving north, dreams, the object, the object of knowledge, the ultimate, the subtle, the letter e, and the unreal.

original: pa'i rang bzhin bdag nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin bdag nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine it as the nature of the saṃbhogakāya.

original: lte ba nas bzung ste kha steng du bltas te g-yas nas rgyu ba'i mgrin pa'i mthar thug gi bar du song nas khrag 'bab pa ro ma zhes pa'i rtsa ste /
analyzed: lte ba nas bzung ste kha steng du bltas te g-yas nas rgyu ba'i mgrin pa'i mthar thug gi bar du song nas khrag 'bab pa ro ma zhes pa'i rtsa ste /
translated: The rasanā is the nāḍī that, beginning from the navel, faces upward, moves through the right side, and reaches the end of the throat. It is the nāḍī where blood flows.

original: gsung dang nyi ma dang k'a li dang snying rje dang lam nas 'byung ba dang nyin par 'char pa dang lho nas rgyu ba dang sad pa dang 'dzin pa dang shes byed dang kun rdzob dang rags pa dang / bam yig dngos por bsdus pa'i rang bzhin thams cad kyi bdag nyid can sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bor mos par bya'o //
analyzed: gsung dang nyi ma dang k'a li dang snying rje dang lam nas 'byung ba dang nyin par 'char pa dang lho nas rgyu ba dang sad pa dang 'dzin pa dang shes byed dang kun rdzob dang rags pa dang / bam yig dngos por bsdus pa'i rang bzhin thams cad kyi bdag nyid can sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bor mos par bya'o //
translated: It should be contemplated as the nature of all the entities that are included in the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, such as speech, the sun, the kālī line, compassion, arising from the path, arising in the day, moving from the south, being awakened, apprehending, the object of knowledge, the relative, the coarse, and the syllable vaṃ.

original: de nas dbus nas rgyu ba kha 'og tu bltas pa chu shing gi me tog ltar 'phyang ba snum pa dang ldan pa'i mar me lta bur byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa kun 'dar ma zhes bya ba'i rtsa ste /
analyzed: de nas dbus nas rgyu ba kha 'og tu bltas pa chu shing gi me tog ltar 'phyang ba snum pa dang ldan pa'i mar me lta bur byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa kun 'dar ma zhes bya ba'i rtsa ste /
translated: The lalanā is the nāḍī that moves in the center, faces downward, hangs like a plantain flower, is oily, and is like a lamp. It is the nāḍī where bodhicitta flows. It is called the “nāḍī of all vibration.”

original: thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid dang snying rje mi phyed pa byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid can chos kyi sku'i ngo bo gnyis su med pa rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid dang snying rje mi phyed pa byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid can chos kyi sku'i ngo bo gnyis su med pa rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that all is of the nature of emptiness and compassion, indivisible, the nature of the mind of enlightenment, the essence of the body of reality, nondual, and of the nature of mere consciousness.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lor son pa'i rtsa gsum po gcig gi rang bzhin de khor stong cha gsum pa lta bu'i bu gu can rva bsdoms pa lta bu rdo rje'i rnam pa lta bu 'am /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lor son pa'i rtsa gsum po gcig gi rang bzhin de khor stong cha gsum pa lta bu'i bu gu can rva bsdoms pa lta bu rdo rje'i rnam pa lta bu 'am /
translated: The three channels that reach the emanation wheel are of the nature of one, with three empty parts like a hollow tube, like a vajra,

original: yang na bya rog gdong can lta bu ste rtsa'i gtso bo sku @234b gsung thugs gcig pa'i rang bzhin can nam mkha' ltar spros pa med cing ma gos pa bde ba chen po'i sku'i rang bzhin du bdag med ma rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bya rog gdong can lta bu ste rtsa'i gtso bo sku @234b gsung thugs gcig pa'i rang bzhin can nam mkha' ltar spros pa med cing ma gos pa bde ba chen po'i sku'i rang bzhin du bdag med ma rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or like a crow’s beak. The principal channel is of the nature of the body, speech, and mind as one, like space, free from elaborations, unstained, and of the nature of the body of great bliss. One should meditate on Nairātmya in that way.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis kyang don dam par mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis kyang don dam par mngon sum du byed do //
translated: Also, by the power of meditation, one realizes the ultimate in actuality.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las rtsa'i gtso bo bsgom pa'i cho ga ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las rtsa'i gtso bo bsgom pa'i cho ga ste dgu pa'o /
translated: These are the rite of meditation on the principal nāḍī from the Instructions of Nairātmya.

original: // / de nas sngags pa dbang dang ldan pas sngar gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi gnas su zhugs shing stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: // / de nas sngags pa dbang dang ldan pas sngar gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi gnas su zhugs shing stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
translated: Then, the powerful mantrin, having entered the previously described place of concentration and sat on a comfortable seat,

original: bsrung ba dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i cho ga byas nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyis bdag med mar mos par bya'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i cho ga byas nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyis bdag med mar mos par bya'o //
translated: having performed the rite of protection, maṇḍala, and so on, one should imagine oneself as Nairātmya with an equipoised mind.

original: de nas sprul pa'i khang pa rgyun du gnas pa can rang gi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis bskor ba brtse ba dang bral bas gdungs te /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i khang pa rgyun du gnas pa can rang gi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis bskor ba brtse ba dang bral bas gdungs te /
translated: Then, the emanated house, which is constantly present, is surrounded by a halo of one’s own light, and is tormented by the absence of affection.

original: brtse ba dang phrad pas 'dod pa'i yi ge mchog gi rang bzhin du btsun mo chen mo bdag med ma /
analyzed: brtse ba dang phrad pas 'dod pa'i yi ge mchog gi rang bzhin du btsun mo chen mo bdag med ma /
translated: The great queen Nairātmya, who is the nature of the supreme letter of desire, is united with affection.

original: zhes bya ba rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: One should visualize her.

original: de la chos kyi khang pa rgyun du gnas pa'i gnas la gnas pa yang /
analyzed: de la chos kyi khang pa rgyun du gnas pa'i gnas la gnas pa yang /
translated: The house of Dharma, which is constantly present, is located in the place

original: nyi ma lta bu 'bar ba dang ldan pas 'dod pa lta bur 'khyud pa dang 'dod pa'i mchog tu gyur pa'i rje btsun dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba'i rgyal po chen po des 'od zer gyi pho nya btang ste lta bar byed do //
analyzed: nyi ma lta bu 'bar ba dang ldan pas 'dod pa lta bur 'khyud pa dang 'dod pa'i mchog tu gyur pa'i rje btsun dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba'i rgyal po chen po des 'od zer gyi pho nya btang ste lta bar byed do //
translated: The great king, the glorious Heruka, the most excellent of the desirous, who is blazing like the sun, embraces her like the desirous, and sends out the messengers of light rays to look at her.

original: de nas 'od zer gyi pho nya bkug nas khyer ba dang chags pa lta bur rjes su chags pa'i dga' bas rnyed de 'khyud pas kyang thob pa ni dbul mos gter rnyed pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer gyi pho nya bkug nas khyer ba dang chags pa lta bur rjes su chags pa'i dga' bas rnyed de 'khyud pas kyang thob pa ni dbul mos gter rnyed pa lta bu'am /
translated: Then, having summoned the messengers of light rays, he is delighted by the passion of the embrace, and having obtained her, he is like a poor woman who has found a treasure,

original: bkren pas dgos pa khyad par can gyi ston mo zos pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: bkren pas dgos pa khyad par can gyi ston mo zos pa lta bu'am /
