translated: or like a pauper who has eaten the food of a special feast,

original: sos ka'i tshad pas gdungs pa la chu bsil bas dbang bskur ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sos ka'i tshad pas gdungs pa la chu bsil bas dbang bskur ba lta bu ste /
translated: or like one tormented by the heat of summer being anointed with cool water.

original: mchog gi bde ba thob par gyur pas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis don dam pa mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: mchog gi bde ba thob par gyur pas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis don dam pa mngon du bya'o //
translated: Having obtained the supreme bliss, one should manifest the ultimate through the power of meditation.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las lhan cig skyes pa'i btsun mo bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las lhan cig skyes pa'i btsun mo bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bcu pa'o /
translated: These are the instructions on Nairātmya, the tenth chapter on the meditation on the innate queen.

original: // / de nas sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sngags pas ji skad gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi gnas su stan bde ba la 'dug nas bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i cho ga bya ste /🔽bdag nyid bdag med mar mos la lte bar sbrul lta bur 'khyil ba'i rnam par gnas pa gnyid log pa ltar ma sad pa chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can bdag med ma'i ngo bo shes rab la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can thams kyi rang bzhin
analyzed: // / de nas sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sngags pas ji skad gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi gnas su stan bde ba la 'dug nas bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i cho ga bya ste / bdag nyid bdag med mar mos la lte bar sbrul lta bur 'khyil ba'i rnam par gnas pa gnyid log pa ltar ma sad pa chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can bdag med ma'i ngo bo shes rab la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can thams kyi rang bzhin
translated: Then the mantrin who has the previously described characteristics, having sat down on a comfortable seat in a place for contemplation as described, should perform the rite of the protection wheel, and so on.🔽Having visualized oneself as Nairātmya, one should awaken the form of Nairātmya, which is the nature of the dharmakāya, as if asleep, not stirring, coiled like a snake at the navel.

original: dpal he ru ka'i ngo bo sna'i lam nas zhugs nas rlung gis rab tu mnan pas sad par bya'o //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i ngo bo sna'i lam nas zhugs nas rlung gis rab tu mnan pas sad par bya'o //
translated: The nature of wisdom, which is the nature of the saṃbhogakāya, the nature of the glorious Heruka, having entered by the path of the nose, should be awakened by the wind, pressing down.

original: @235a * // de nas de dbyug pas reg pa'i sprul mo ltar dbyu gu'i rnam pa ltar langs te kha'i bu ga nas me 'bar ba ltar blta'o //
analyzed: @235a * // de nas de dbyug pas reg pa'i sprul mo ltar dbyu gu'i rnam pa ltar langs te kha'i bu ga nas me 'bar ba ltar blta'o //
translated: Then, like a female snake touched by a stick, one should rise in the form of a staff, and one should see the fire blazing from the mouth.

original: de nas des shin tu yang 'bar ba dang 'jig rten gsum yang bsregs par bsams te /
analyzed: de nas des shin tu yang 'bar ba dang 'jig rten gsum yang bsregs par bsams te /
translated: Then, by that, it blazes even more and burns the three worlds.

original: de'i stobs de lta pus bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin ri bong can du de ma thag tu zhu bar gyur pas rgyun gyi rnam par blugs par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de'i stobs de lta pus bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin ri bong can du de ma thag tu zhu bar gyur pas rgyun gyi rnam par blugs par bsgoms la /
translated: By the power of that, the moon, which is the nature of nectar, immediately melts and is imagined to be poured into the stream.

original: de nas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis don dam pa mngon sum du bya zhing nam mkha'i phyogs thams cad du spro'o //
analyzed: de nas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis don dam pa mngon sum du bya zhing nam mkha'i phyogs thams cad du spro'o //
translated: Then, by the power of meditation, one should actualize the ultimate and emanate it in all directions of space.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las rlung gi shes rab bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las rlung gi shes rab bsgom pa'i cho ga ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter on the ritual of meditating on the wisdom of the wind from the instructions of Nairātmya.

original: // / de nas sngags pas dbang du gyur pa bsam gtan gyi gnas su rab tu zhugs nas gnas dang bdag dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba'i cho ga bya zhing dkyil 'khor mchod pa'i cho ga yang bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas sngags pas dbang du gyur pa bsam gtan gyi gnas su rab tu zhugs nas gnas dang bdag dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba'i cho ga bya zhing dkyil 'khor mchod pa'i cho ga yang bya ste /
translated: Then, the mantrin, having entered the place of concentration, having become powerful, should perform the ritual of protecting the place, oneself, and the yogin, and also perform the ritual of offering to the maṇḍala.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag ba aom pra kri ti pa ri shuddho& ham zhes brjod de bdag med par blta'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag ba aom pra kri ti pa ri shuddho& ham zhes brjod de bdag med par blta'o //
translated: One should view the absence of self by reciting Om, pure by nature, I am pure by nature, and all phenomena are naturally pure.

original: de nas bdag med ma de nu ma de nu ma nang du thim par gyur cing rang gi padma'i ze 'bru las skyes pa rdo rje 'gram gnyis ni dril bu ste chags pa dang bcas shing chags pa'i lta bas bltas pas gang yang rung ba ste dombi n'ir
analyzed: de nas bdag med ma de nu ma de nu ma nang du thim par gyur cing rang gi padma'i ze 'bru las skyes pa rdo rje 'gram gnyis ni dril bu ste chags pa dang bcas shing chags pa'i lta bas bltas pas gang yang rung ba ste dombi n'ir
translated: Then, that Nairātmya dissolves into the breast, and one should view the two sides of the vajra born from the pericarp of one's lotus as a bell, with passion and a passionate gaze, either the one or the other, as Dombi Heruka.

original: blta'o // de yang sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par dang mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: blta'o // de yang sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par dang mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ste /
translated: That is the essence of the path of preparation, seeing, meditation, distinction, and culmination.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par las so //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par las so //
translated: It is due to the distinction of moments such as the various types.

original: zla ba gang ba lta bu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin can lhan cig skyes pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin dpal he ru ka la 'khyud pa ni na ma mkha' lta bu'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa shes rab kyi ngo bor bdag
analyzed: zla ba gang ba lta bu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin can lhan cig skyes pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin dpal he ru ka la 'khyud pa ni na ma mkha' lta bu'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa shes rab kyi ngo bor bdag
translated: The full moon is the nature of the saṃbhogakāya, and the embrace of Śrī Heruka, the nature of all coemergences, is the mother, the nature of the dharmakāya, like the sky, coemergence, the nature of wisdom, Nairātmya.

original: med ma mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: med ma mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: One should actualize her.

original: mngon du byas pa dang // yan lag dang / nyin lag thams cad la'o //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa dang // yan lag dang / nyin lag thams cad la'o //
translated: Having actualized her, one should visualize all the limbs and minor limbs.

original: de las phyogs bcu'i dngos po thams cad du spros te /
analyzed: de las phyogs bcu'i dngos po thams cad du spros te /
translated: From that, one should emanate all things in the ten directions.

original: rnam par spros pa thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par spros pa thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Having emanated all, one should make them one’s own nature.

original: des bdag tu byas pa dang / sems tsam gyi bdag nyid du rnam par bsam mo //
analyzed: des bdag tu byas pa dang / sems tsam gyi bdag nyid du rnam par bsam mo //
translated: Having made them one’s own, one should visualize them as the nature of mind only.

original: de bsams pa dang rtog pa med par bya'o //

original: de'i steng nas mnyam pa'i snod che bas kha bcang de dbus su bde byed kyi mig gi grva'i 'khor lo'i rnam pa la bdud rtsi dang sgron ma'i phye ma cho gas sbyangs te btab la /

translated: On top of that, one should cover it with a larger vessel. In the center of that, one should place the nectar and the lamp powder in the form of a wheel in the corner of the eye of Bhairava.

analyzed: der lcags gsum las byas pa'i thur mas chos 'byung gi nang du sna tshogs rdo rjes bris pas bskor te /

translated: The nature of Nairātmya together with the letters and the drops is the vajra stūpa, which the mantrin should draw according to the guru’s instruction, facing west.

translated: Then, one should introduce the gnosis into the commitments, the five articles of worship, the five special qualities of the five nectars, the supreme lamp, and the refined elixir, which are eaten, drunk, enjoyed, and sucked.

translated: Then, having performed the scattering libation, having offered the mandala and the gift, having made them equal, one should say, “Please forgive me!” and having said, “The wheel of the Bhagavatī dissolves into me,” one should request her to depart and one should perform the feast oneself.

analyzed: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las phyi rol mchod pa'i cho ga ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter on the external worship rite from the teaching of Nairātmya.

analyzed: // / de nas dad pa dang bsnyen bkur du ldan pa'i slob mas mandala dang phyag byas te /
translated: Then, the disciple who is endowed with faith and respect, having made a mandala offering and prostrations,

translated: He should perform any yoga of moving the body.

translated: Then, imagining that he has made an offering with the supreme repetition of the three realities, he should light a great butter lamp and also burn incense.

original: aom lo le le h'um aa zhes bsgyings pa'i sngags kyis ji srid ma phebs kyi bar du dbab tho //
analyzed: aom lo le le h'um aa zhes bsgyings pa'i sngags kyis ji srid ma phebs kyi bar du dbab tho //
translated: He should ring the bell with the mantra of splendor, “Oṃ lole līlī hūṃ a,” until the descent of the awareness being.

original: phebs pa dang rim gyis sam cig car du ba mos reg pa lta bu'am ba spu ldang ba dang g-yo ba dang mchi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phebs pa dang rim gyis sam cig car du ba mos reg pa lta bu'am ba spu ldang ba dang g-yo ba dang mchi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it has descended, he should be touched with smoke from burning frankincense, and his body hair will stand on end, he will tremble, and tears will flow.

original: yang na chang gi stobs kyis phog pa lta bu 'gyel ba dang mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ltar yang bde ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chang gi stobs kyis phog pa lta bu 'gyel ba dang mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ltar yang bde ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Or else, like one who has fallen down from the power of alcohol, or like one who has attained supreme nirvana, he should generate bliss.

original: de nas bslang las dpar gyur pa dang slob mas mandala byas la rnal 'byor dang / mchod pa dang sngags dang cho ga rnams rim gyis bstan no //
analyzed: de nas bslang las dpar gyur pa dang slob mas mandala byas la rnal 'byor dang / mchod pa dang sngags dang cho ga rnams rim gyis bstan no //
translated: Then, having been raised up, the disciple, having made a maṇḍala, should be taught the yoga, the worship, the mantras, and the rites in sequence.

original: dad pa dang bral ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dad pa dang bral ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not to those who are devoid of faith.

original: des kyang bla ma'i bka' lung me tog dri ma med pa lta bu mgo thog tu bkur te /
analyzed: des kyang bla ma'i bka' lung me tog dri ma med pa lta bu mgo thog tu bkur te /
translated: He, too, should carry on his head the guru’s command, which is like a stainless flower.

original: de nas bzung ste bcom ldan 'das ma dang bla ma dang rnal 'byor ma rnams la mnyam par gus pas bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bzung ste bcom ldan 'das ma dang bla ma dang rnal 'byor ma rnams la mnyam par gus pas bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: From then on, he should serve the Bhagavatī, the guru, and the yoginīs with equal devotion.

original: de dag ni bdag med ma'i man ngag las slob ma rjes su gzung ba'i cho ga ste bco lnga pa'o /🔽// / bdag med man ngag byas pa yi //

translated: This is the rite of accepting the disciple from the Nairātmyā Upadeśa, the fifteenth.

original: bdag gi bsod nams gang byung ba //
analyzed: bdag gi bsod nams gang byung ba //
translated: Whatever merit I have produced🔽by composing the Nairātmyā Upadeśa,

original: des ni 'gro rnams myur ba ru //
analyzed: des ni 'gro rnams myur ba ru //
translated: may it quickly cause all beings

original: bdag med rgyal ba'i yum 'gyur shog / bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bdag med ma'i man ngag rdzogs so /
analyzed: bdag med rgyal ba'i yum 'gyur shog / bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bdag med ma'i man ngag rdzogs so /
translated: This instruction on Nairātmya, the stage of self-consecration, is complete.

original: // /'di yang dpal au rgyan gyi gnas na gnas pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi zhal nas byung ba //
analyzed: // /'di yang dpal au rgyan gyi gnas na gnas pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi zhal nas byung ba //
translated: This also arose from the mouths of the yoginīs of the land of Oḍḍiyāna, who are coemergent.

original: rnal 'byor ma kun gyi thugs mchog tu gsang ba'i gzugs can snying po las shin tu snying po /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma kun gyi thugs mchog tu gsang ba'i gzugs can snying po las shin tu snying po /
translated: It is the essence of the essence of the secret form of the supreme mind of all yoginīs.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma byas pa rnams ni ma dad cing bla ma'i zhabs kyi padma la ma bsnyen pa dag gis mi thob ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma byas pa rnams ni ma dad cing bla ma'i zhabs kyi padma la ma bsnyen pa dag gis mi thob ste /

original: 'di'i yon tan mtha' yas pa'i gzhi dang / bden par yid ches par byed pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar 'dod pa'i don grub pa /
analyzed: 'di'i yon tan mtha' yas pa'i gzhi dang / bden par yid ches par byed pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar 'dod pa'i don grub pa /
translated: The basis of its limitless qualities is the wish-fulfilling gem, which is the cause of accomplishing the desired aim, and which inspires confidence in the truth.

original: chu'i rgyun ltar bsten pas 'bras bu ster ba can /
analyzed: chu'i rgyun ltar bsten pas 'bras bu ster ba can /
translated: It is like a stream of water, which gives a result when relied upon.

original: nam mkha' ltar ro mnyam pa 'di rna ba gcig nas gcig tu byung bas na bla ma dam pa'i man ngag las /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar ro mnyam pa 'di rna ba gcig nas gcig tu byung bas na bla ma dam pa'i man ngag las /
translated: It is like space, which is of equal taste. This arose from ear to ear. Therefore, it is from the instructions of the sublime guru.

original: brjed par dogs pas rang dran pa'i don du bdag gis bris pas de'i phyir dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma @237b rnams la bzod par gsol zhing /
analyzed: brjed par dogs pas rang dran pa'i don du bdag gis bris pas de'i phyir dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma @237b rnams la bzod par gsol zhing /
